results.title: Mother tongue. No. 3. Reading and writing
results.creator_credit: George Inger, Eileen Molony and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Part of a series providing an insight into the stages by which young children from birth to 11 years old learn to use, understand, read and write their own language. Deals mainly with the introduction of writing as part of general language development.

results.title: Mother of many children
results.creator_credit: Alanis Obomsawin and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This film is an album of Native womanhood, portraying a proud egalitarian matriarchal society that for centuries has been pressured to adopt different standards and customs. All of the women featured share a belief in the importance of tradition as a source of strength in the face of change. Ethnographic documentation of Native Canadian ‘American’ post colonialisation which includes documented accounts of the ‘stolen generation’ in Native American tribes and personal accounts of racial discrimination. Directed, written, produced and narrated by Alanis Obomsawin. (Awards: San Francisco; Dieppe)

results.title: Mother of kings = Sons and comrades = Matka krolow
results.creator_credit: Janusz Zaorski, Film Polski, Rondo and Zespol Filmowy X
results.brief_description: Sons and comrades is a powerful political drama based on the novel by Kazimierz Brandys with screenplay and direction by Janusz Zaorski. Spanning the period 1933-1956, it tells the story of Lucja Krol (Magda Teresa Wojcik), an unemployed widow with four sons, and her struggle to survive almost twenty-five years of economic depression, poverty, occupation of Poland by the Nazis, persecution and political oppression. To Lucja, holding the family together was paramount. For her sons, it was the fight for an independent Poland, free of Nazi Germany control, and a total commitment to the Communist Party. However, at the end of the war with a new regime in Poland, another form of persecution began to take place. Instead of freedom and peace, the 1950s became a time of fear, when friend betrayed friend and former heroes of the independence struggle were jailed as traitors - a time of expedient political trials, torture and even death. It is during this time that Klemens (Boguslaw Linda) Lucja’s son, is inexplicably arrested and accused of being a collaborator. His eventual fate is never revealed to Lucja. A stark film of harsh reality portraying a time of political upheaval and uncertainty in Poland. “Mother of kings” was shelved for five years until 1987 when censorship restrictions became more relaxed in communist Poland. It is an outstanding film with superb direction by Janusz Zaorski and an excellent cast including Zbigniew Zapasiewicz, Franciszek Pieczka, Michal Juszczakiewicz, Adam Ferency. (Awards: Poland 1987; Berlin 1988)

results.title: Mother hen's family
results.brief_description: A young boy’s observations of the development of a chick embryo are used to introduce elementary concepts of reproduction and growth. Shows growth and development of a living embryo, hatching of egg and growth of young chicken.

results.title: Mother Goose rhymes: background for reading and expression
results.brief_description: Brings to life, in “Mother Goose Land”, a host of nursery favourites: Little Bo-Peep, London Bridge, Jack-Be-Nimble, The Old Woman who lived in a Shoe and others. Designed as a stimulus for junior grades, in reading and expression.

results.title: Mother earth, father sky
results.creator_credit: John Holmstrom and Ford Motor Company
results.brief_description: Years ago all America was the outdoors but only the Indians understood the true beauty of it all. As immigrants built roads, the meaning of the outdoors changed and became more accessible. Now outdoor enjoyment tends to be more organised, but whether it is bike riding in Central Park in New York or walking in the Grand Canyon, all interests can be catered for. “By being outdoors we all gain a special look at ourselves through Nature”.

results.title: Mother earth
results.creator_credit: L. Scott-Ehrenberg, Charles Blanks and Rural Bank of New South Wales
results.brief_description: Diary of Brian Gordon. Brian Gordon and his younger brother Michael, Sydneysiders, embark on a trip to rural New South Wales. Taken by the peace and lifestyle of the farming districts, both regret their imminent return to the city. But as luck would have it, Brian meets and falls in love with an orphaned country girl, Marian. Fortunately Brian is able to arrange a Rural Bank of New South Wales loan to assist himself and the cash-strapped Marian save her farm. A patriotic and heroic view of the idealised bush of a by-gone era. NB: A promotional film for the Rural Bank of New South Wales.

results.title: Mother cat and her baby skunks
results.creator_credit: Milan Herzog and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: A mother cat finds three baby skunks in the woods that have lost their mother. She adopts them and induces them to return to the farmyard where she has three kittens of her own. The baby skunks and kittens are shown developing side by side. The farm dog lives in harmony with the cat and helps her to protect the babies.

results.title: Mother and son. No. 2
results.brief_description: Ruth Cracknell and Gary McDonald play Maggie and Arthur. Maggie appears to be losing her memory but retains enough to take full advantage of having her younger son, Arthur, living at home with her and on call for her needs whether he likes it or not. This program includes the episodes, “The Card Game”; “The Promotion”; “The Funeral”.
